fact_check_explanation_title: It is not illegal to drive with pyjamas on in the UK
fact_check_explanation_summary: The article presented as evidence of the new law in this claim is an April Fool’s joke.

fact_check_explanation_title: Poverty hasn’t skyrocketed in the UK
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Joseph Rowntree Foundation said “there has been little change in overall poverty levels for more than 15 years.”

fact_check_explanation_title: Scotland’s maths and science scores are falling in international tests but rising in national tests
fact_check_explanation_summary: Boris Johnson’s claims about education in Scotland are not all quite right.

fact_check_explanation_title: There are some mistakes in these figures about lung cancer diagnoses
fact_check_explanation_summary: The figures in this article are inaccurate, leading to exaggerated claims about late lung cancer diagnoses in A&E.

fact_check_explanation_title: Daily Mirror incorrectly reports the results of statins and blood pressure drugs study.
fact_check_explanation_summary: A study found that taking statins or blood pressure pills increased the likelihood of obesity by 82%, but the findings can’t be applied to the wider population.

fact_check_explanation_title: This image on benefits for pensioners and refugees is not correct
fact_check_explanation_summary: This viral image claims that pensioners can collect just a fifth of the benefits ‘illegal immigrants’ and refugees can. But how much can each group really get?

fact_check_explanation_title: These aren’t satellite images and they don’t show evidence of mass cremations in Wuhan
fact_check_explanation_summary: Images claiming to show high levels of sulphur dioxide above Wuhan are not based on real satellite data.

fact_check_explanation_title: Prisoners don’t have to pay the TV licence whereas most pensioners will soon have to
fact_check_explanation_summary: Prisoners who have a TV in their cell are exempt from the TV licence fee, but pay a weekly rental charge.

fact_check_explanation_title: The figures in this post give an inaccurate view of Britain
fact_check_explanation_summary: The figures in this post are either out of date or inaccurate in their claims. However, it is unlikely people are taking them seriously.

fact_check_explanation_title: Unpublished Home Office target needs explaining
fact_check_explanation_summary: Figures reportedly briefed by the Home Office suggest that migration law change could cut unskilled EU migration by 90,000. That’s higher than the number of unskilled EU migrants coming to …

fact_check_explanation_title: One in seven parents don’t read to their 7-9 year-old for more than 15 minutes per week
fact_check_explanation_summary: Research found one in seven parents spend less than 15 minutes a week reading to their young children, but that doesn’t mean one in seven children are read to for …

fact_check_explanation_title: Universal Credit has not got 200,000 people into work
fact_check_explanation_summary: The prime minister is wrong to claim that a government prediction about the benefits of Universal Credit has already come true.
